articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz ordered the army on Thursday to prepare a plan to allow the "voluntary departure" of residents from the Gaza strip, Israeli media reported.
articles.title: Israel's defense minister orders army to prepare for Gaza residents' departure, media reports

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The increase in accuracy to within 50-100m of the intended target suggests North Korea is successfully using the battlefield to test its missile technology, senior Ukrainian sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine sees marked improvement in accuracy of Russia's North Korean missiles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "We are staying here and dying here."
articles.title: Palestinian who survived 1948 Nakba rejects Trump's Gaza relocation plan

articles.author: Oliver Griffin
articles.description: Ecuador's President Daniel Noboa is betting that his pledges to push crime-fighting initiatives begun under his truncated first administration and to tackle power cuts will secure him a full term in Sunday's presidential election.
articles.title: Daniel Noboa, the Ecuador banana heir seeking full presidential term

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations Special Rapporteur on the Occupied Palestinian Territories said on Thursday that Israel's decision to withdraw from the U.N. Human Rights Council was "extremely serious".
articles.title: UN Special Rapporteur criticises Israel withdrawal from UN Human Rights Council

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's foreign intelligence service released an English-language video on Thursday, urging "true American patriots" who care about world peace to get in touch via secure communication in response to efforts by the CIA to recruit Russians.
articles.title: Russia's spies, in retaliation against the CIA, urge Americans to get in touch

articles.author: Rachael Levy
articles.description: Democrats on the U.S. House oversight committee on Thursday called for an investigation of potential national security threats posed by Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency.
articles.title: House Democrats push security probe of Elon Musk's team

articles.author: Guillermo Martinez, Violeta Santos Moura
articles.description: Former Spanish soccer federation boss Luis Rubiales' unsolicited kiss killed Jenni Hermoso's joy at winning the women's World Cup in 2023 and she was overwhelmed, crying and exhausted in the following hours and days, three of her teammates told the High Court on Thursday.
articles.title: Hermoso's teammates tell Spain's High Court that Rubiales' kiss killed her joy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France is being inundated by a "white tsunami" of cocaine, the interior minister said on Thursday, with authorities seizing more than double the amount of the drug last year in an illicit economy linked to violent crimes.
articles.title: As French cocaine seizures more than double in 2024, new campaign targets users

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis is suffering from bronchitis but plans to maintain his scheduled appointments in the coming days, the Vatican said on Thursday.
articles.title: Pope Francis has bronchitis but will keep his schedule, Vatican says
